title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 02 July 2015 - XWiki
content:
<gsmeria> has quit  
00:07 <evalica1> has quit  
00:37 <vmassol> has quit  
00:42 <Enygma`> has quit  
02:03 <abusenius\_> has quit  
06:42 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
07:00 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
07:47 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
07:48 <gsmeria> has quit  
07:56 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
08:19 <cjd> has quit  
08:41 <woshilapin> has quit  
08:57 <mflorea> has quit  
09:06 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
09:06 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
09:12 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:17 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:17 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:18 <vmassol> msmeria: good morning  
09:19 <msmeria> vmassol: hello  
09:19 <vmassol> could you please let me know when you're done with http://design.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Proposal/NestedSpaces or remove your lock?  
09:20 <cjd> Someone write this realtime collaboration extension for XWiki, it's really nice  <trollface>  
09:20 <cjd> also good morning :)  
09:20 <vmassol> cjd: yes I agree  
09:20 <msmeria> vmassol: you can edit it now  
09:20 <vmassol> thanks msmeria  
09:20 <msmeria> yw  
09:20 <vmassol> I'm updating the user stories now with teh latest versin  
09:20 <vmassol> should be the final version :)  
09:21 <vmassol> cjd: working well enough to be put on xwiki.org?  
09:21 <cjd> for text, I'm highly in favor  
09:21 <cjd> myxwiki.org is much more complicated because it's a mishmash of different xar versions with various levels of customization  
09:22 <cjd> but xwiki.org, big +1  
09:22 <vmassol> ok, I'll push for it then, thanks  
09:22 <cjd> thank you :)  
09:22 <cjd> Love to see our stuff being used  
09:22 <vmassol> any perf impact?  
09:22 <cjd> Should be approx 0  
09:22 <vmassol> cool  
09:23 <cjd> it doesn't use http requests, it bypasses tomcat entirely and uses a netty websocket  
09:23 <cjd> so it doesn't do requests which run through XWikiAction/XWikiContext/Struts/wheeeeee  
09:36 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
09:48 <vmassol> msmeria: btw thanks for helping us test the NS/ND feture! :)  
09:48 <vmassol> I see you've started already!  
09:49 <vmassol> msmeria: i think the CR1-6 are supposed to work already but Edy should know better  
09:52 <vmassol> msmeria: actually, I wonder if we shouldn't move all the user stories to test.xwiki.org  
09:52 <msmeria> vmassol: thanks. I'll talk to Edy  
09:52 <msmeria> Ramona will create manual tests for each scenario tested  
09:52 <vmassol> ok cool  
10:04 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:08 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:12 <vmassol> has quit  
10:13 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
10:13 <gsmeria1> has joined #xwiki  
10:13 <gsmeria> has quit  
10:32 <vmassol> creating project for yann  
10:37 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:38 <cjd> oh excellent, thanks, I would have done it but missed it on the list  
10:40 <vmassol> done  
10:41 <cjd> thanks  
10:42 <cjd> I suppose we should get yann in the irc chat here  
10:45 <vmassol> could be nice indeed  
10:45 <vmassol> and generally speaking would be nice if he could ask for feedback about the IDE needs on the lists  
10:46 <vmassol> he might get interesting info  
10:47 <cjd> Yes indeed, perhaps I should start another thread for that purpose  
11:00 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:01 <Trefex> has joined #xwiki  
11:22 <vmassol> grr I hate when it does this: http://design.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Proposal/NestedSpaces?viewer=changes&rev2=77.1 I'd love to fix this  
11:24 <gsmeria1> has quit  
11:26 <ramona\_> has joined #xwiki  
11:27 <vmassol> ramona\_: hi  
11:27 <vmassol> just saw that you tested PE1/PE2  
11:27 <vmassol> thanks for that!  
11:27 <vmassol> quick question: you validated it with nested spaces right?  
11:28 <vmassol> (and setting the permissions at different levels on the WebHome in the hierarchy)  
11:30 <vmassol> (just want to make sure we're testing the right thing since these are the first tests)  
11:31 <cjd> ahh the curse of code which is both human and machine written  
11:31 <cjd> we (cjdns) have the same problem with config files  
11:31 <tmortagne> vmassol: at least now you are sure the tables customization were hand written :)  
11:32 <vmassol> tmortagne: hehe  
11:33 <vmassol> btw I'm curious to know ramona\_ whether you made the last change at http://design.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Proposal/NestedSpaces?viewer=changes&rev2=77.1  or not  
11:33 <vmassol> if not then it looks like a bug  
11:34 <vmassol> cjd: yeah… the problem is that we have several ways of representing the same content  
11:35 <vmassol> (because users are humans and we can't be too strict for usability)  
11:35 <cjd> yup  
11:35 <vmassol> (thus the solution would be to save the user's customization in our DOM so that we can keep them when we reserialize)  
11:35 <cjd> We have the same problem with config files, no easy way out except to have the serializer look at the original version and try to be as concervitive as possible when changing it  
11:36 <vmassol> the \\ is another issue though, which could probably be fixed  
11:36 <vmassol> (I'm not sure I fully understand why we have it)  
11:37 <vmassol> (it's supposed to represent a new line)  
11:37 <ramona\_> So I tested only at a document level. And now I am talking with Marius about the functionality  
11:37 <vmassol> ramona\_: document leve is ok that's the point of PE1/PE2  
11:37 <vmassol> but a nested dcument  
11:37 <vmassol> :)  
11:37 <vmassol> ok good that you're talking with Marius  
11:37 <vmassol> \*level  
11:38 <vmassol> please check my second question too  
11:40 <ramona\_> now i will try with a nested document and also with different levels  
11:41 <vmassol> ramona\_: what about my second question?  
11:42 <vmassol> "btw I'm curious to know ramona\_ whether you made the last change at http://design.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Proposal/NestedSpaces?viewer=changes&rev2=77.1  or not  
11:42 <vmassol> if not then it looks like a bug"  
11:42 <vmassol> (precisely the removal of the space)  
11:43 <ramona\_> i didn't do those changes  
11:43 <vmassol> ok thanks then it's a bug I think, I'll try to reproduce  
11:43 <ramona\_> I only added Tested/Passed  
11:44 <vmassol> k thx  
11:56 <ramona\_> has quit  
11:56 <evalica> has quit  
11:57 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:57 <Ramona1> has joined #xwiki  
12:05 <Ramona1> has quit  
12:05 <msmeria> vmassol: hello again  
12:05 <Ramona1> has joined #xwiki  
12:05 <msmeria> I'm trying to test PE4 from http://design.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Proposal/NestedSpaces on a 7.2-snap  
12:06 <msmeria> but I'm unable to set as parent a nested doc for another nested doc  
12:06 <msmeria> is this implemented?  
12:07 <msmeria> from the UI at least I can't add new nested docs, so I have to do it by URL and try to change the parent manually  
12:07 <vmassol> tmortagne: fyi created http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XRENDERING-399 don't know if it's something we have seen already or not  
12:07 <msmeria> I'm trying to create the parent-child relation between multiple nested docs  
12:07 <vmassol> msmeria: the parent/child is deprecated and should not be used  
12:08 <vmassol> to create a nested doc, you can use the url or a velocity script  
12:08 <msmeria> so basically most use cases from Permissions shouldn't even be tested?  
12:08 <vmassol> for example: http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/A/B/C/WebHome  
12:08 <msmeria> is this what you're saying?  
12:08 <vmassol> msmeria: yes they should  
12:08 <vmassol> they should be working  
12:08 <vmassol> not sure I understand what you mean  
12:09 <msmeria> ok, let's keep it simple  
12:09 <vmassol> Nested space is a replacement for parent/child  
12:09 <msmeria> tell me how I can test PE4  
12:09 <msmeria> step by step  
12:09 <vmassol> you create a nested space as I explained above  
12:10 <vmassol> you create some WebHomre, for example A.WebHome and set some permissions  
12:10 <vmassol> you then verify that the permissions you get on A.B.C.WebHome are inherited from A.WebHome  
12:11 <msmeria> ok. so this should happen even if a.WebHome is not the parent of A.B.c.WebHome  
12:11 <msmeria> I thought the parent setting was a must for this test
